intro: Humata patens, commonly known as the spreading humata, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically broad and have a rough texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Humata patens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
